para: This option, along with interp_max_dt, controls when the filter will attempt to fill gaps in your track by creating new, interpolated points.

The filter calculates the median time difference between points in your track. This option is a multiplier for that median time. A gap will only be considered for interpolation if its duration is longer than (interp_min_multiplier * median_time). This prevents the filter from adding unnecessary points to an already dense track.
For example, if your GPS records a point every second on average, and interp_min_multiplier is 1.5, the filter will only consider filling gaps that are longer than 1.5 seconds.

The pre-defined profiles use the following values: 'walking' (2.0), 'running' (1.8), 'cycling' (1.5), 'driving' (1.2), and 'flying' (1.1). A lower value results in more interpolation, while a higher value results in less. If you are using a profile, you do not need to set this option unless you want to override the profile's default.
If you are using a profile, this value is set automatically, but you can override it here.
